intro: Phelline comosa var. canalensis, commonly known as the canalensis phelline, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
